review_title: An amazing work culture and great colleagues!
pros: High trust work environment, great feedback culture that works effectively, increased diversity and a senior leadership team that is committed to improving on inclusivity (the feedback culture really helps), teams and systems are well organised and mission-focused and very passionate and supportive staff.
cons: The work can be intense at times but the senior leadership team are always open to feedback on what could be better.

review_title: Cult like, avoid at all costs
pros: The long term positive impact of what the programme has on students is really inspiring.
cons: The organisation runs like a cult which is highly fuelled by white saviourism. Not a friendly or welcoming environment if you are from an ethic background. Holidays are strict and can only take them at a certain time, often working long hours. Managers are very poor and act like micro managers and talk down to staff. It was one of the strangest organisations I have worked with staff often crying in training sessions, which was very uncomfortable.

job_title: Church Partnerships Manager in London, England
cons: Value of excellence can encourage negative working patterns

pros: Personal development / support from senior staff

job_title: Corporate Coaching Manager in London, England
pros: Brilliant team culture and development. Great work life balance and sense of fun & support.
cons: Charity work means pay not as competitive as other industries.

pros: I genuinely enjoyed working with Resurgo. The senior team cared about the well-being of its staff and I found this to be one of the best things about working with them. Generally speaking, a very healthy work environment.
cons: I didn't particularly enjoy working with my supervisor who did tend to micromanage at times but this is not Resurgo's fault. Also, not much diversity and inclusion in my opinion, and I am not only talking about race diversity, but also ethnical diversity. I know they have been trying g to change this, and I am sure with time they will.

pros:
- The best feedback culture I have ever been a part of, with a genuine intention for people to thrive and be at their best through honest, transparent feedback.
- Great senior leadership team that are honest and transparent about the pros/cons about upcoming changes.
- Fosters an environment of collaboration, non-hierarchal 'the best idea wins' and fun.
- Learn the invaluable life skill of coaching as part of any job description.
cons: - Because of the Spear programme cycle, holiday's are more expensive as you take them in 'school holiday' season.

job_title: People & Culture Manager in London, England
pros: Welcoming environment, feedback culture, supportive and caring management.

review_title: Excellent culture. Kind and open. Supportive. Fantastic use of coaching in all aspects of the business.
pros: Kind people. Not hierarchical. Superb adult to adult interactions. Each employee receives excellent coaching and is trained in coaching. The best team meetings and company communication. Lots of fun.
cons: Typical charity issues regarding pay scales, scarcity mentality, overly cautious, tightly controlling over the vision and external communications. The result is operating in excellence but can also feel constrictive.
